Discrete Inputs

Adding a New Discrete Input

There are two ways to add a new Discrete Input to the configuration:
1. Right-click on the Discrete Inputs group in the System Configuration Tree and select Add Discrete Input.
2. While the Discrete Inputs group is selected, click the Add One button in the upper-right and corner.

Bulk Adding New Discrete Inputs

There are two ways to add a new Discrete Input to the configuration:
1. Right-click on the Discrete Inputs group in the System Configuration Tree and select Bulk Add.
2. While the Discrete Inputs group is selected, click the Add One button in the upper-right and corner.
Confirm the options in the dialog box that appears.

Configuring Discrete Inputs

Name: The VeriStand channel name associated with the Discrete Input.
Address The address of the Discrete Input, zero-indexed. If your slave device lists the Discrete Inputaddresses as between 10001-19999, you will need to subtract 10001 from the value given. Changing the selector next to the Address indicator will toggle input between Decimal and Hexidecimal representations.
Description This is for documentation purposes only, and does not affect the functionality.
